pageContext.claim: “For the cost of resettling one refugee in the United States, we can assist more than 10 in their home region.”
pageContext.analysis: A case can certainly be made that the president is comparing apples and oranges — and that he is relying on an estimate for costs higher than what was produced by his own government (and then squelched because it did not align with administration policy). One can also argue that it makes more sense to balance the costs of caring for refugees with the contributions, monetary or otherwise, they make to society over time.
